commit_message:
Increase min-ready for ubuntu-trusty

We're putting more jobs on ubuntu-trusty, increase min-ready from 1 to 4
to have more images available.

Once the conversion is done, we need to reduce bare-trusty min-ready.

Change-Id: Id287c49aa182b525b40e6b97bc59ed17e61c1a8a

revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2016-03-03 21:46:28.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/pecan_wsgi/startup.py'], 'message': "Fix pecan collection->plugin map for extensions

The way pecan was mapping collections to plugins always assumed
that the same plugin that supported an extension that extended
a given collection was responsible for the collection itself.
This isn't the case for extensions that just add data to a
collection via the dictionary extension mechanisms. For example,
the timestamps are implemented in an extension that is run by
a standalone service plugin that just performs DB updates via
DB hooks and gives the responses to users via the dictionary
extension hooks.

This patch fixes it by checking to ensure the plugin actually
supports the get method for the collection itself before assuming
that the collection belongs to the plugin.

Closes-Bug: #1552926
Change-Id: I22fa396e1ccd6af936fd4d58bbb0638ff5ab4467
"}]
commit_message:
Fix pecan collection->plugin map for extensions

The way pecan was mapping collections to plugins always assumed
that the same plugin that supported an extension that extended
a given collection was responsible for the collection itself.
This isn't the case for extensions that just add data to a
collection via the dictionary extension mechanisms. For example,
the timestamps are implemented in an extension that is run by
a standalone service plugin that just performs DB updates via
DB hooks and gives the responses to users via the dictionary
extension hooks.

This patch fixes it by checking to ensure the plugin actually
supports the get method for the collection itself before assuming
that the collection belongs to the plugin.

Closes-Bug: #1552926
Change-Id: I22fa396e1ccd6af936fd4d58bbb0638ff5ab4467

Sometimes ironic-inspector receives incomplete logs. Trying calling
journalctl with --flush option before to fix it.

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-02-25 14:00:55.000000000', 'files': ['tripleoclient/tests/test_utils.py', 'tripleoclient/tests/v1/baremetal/fakes.py', 'tripleoclient/tests/v1/baremetal/test_baremetal.py', 'tripleoclient/utils.py', 'tripleoclient/v1/baremetal.py'], 'message': 'Fix ironic-inspector client usage

Right now we are using the ironic-inspector-client functions directly with
providing the auth token. This is deprecated in favor of providing the session.
However, inside the OSC plugin the introspection client is already available,
so just use it directly. This patch also stops redefining --inspector-url which

Change-Id: I9538e32967103f71c2af94077eb1994462a88d18

commit_message:
Fix ironic-inspector client usage

Right now we are using the ironic-inspector-client functions directly with
providing the auth token. This is deprecated in favor of providing the session.
However, inside the OSC plugin the introspection client is already available,
so just use it directly. This patch also stops redefining --inspector-url which
is already defined by ironic-inspector-client.

Change-Id: I9538e32967103f71c2af94077eb1994462a88d18

addresses and networks. This can be enabled by setting
prefer-ipv6=True.

Closes-Bug: 1513524

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-12-28 18:38:16.000000000', 'files': ['nova/context.py'], 'message': "Replace copy.deepcopy of RequestContext with copy.copy

Instance of RequestContext contains many objects and some of them like
mutexes could not be copied. Also a deepcopy of the entire
RequestContext wastes CPU time.

To avoid problems with deepcopy and avoid performance overhead this
patch changes deepcopy of RequestContext to shallow copy and makes
deepcopy of only the 'roles' member because of security issue
LP #1386932.

Closes-Bug: #1506958
Related-Bug: #1386932
Change-Id: I1e2c00e95e1c4bcd0ec7bf075458789d6fb06e99
"}]
commit_message:
Replace copy.deepcopy of RequestContext with copy.copy

Instance of RequestContext contains many objects and some of them like
mutexes could not be copied. Also a deepcopy of the entire
RequestContext wastes CPU time.

To avoid problems with deepcopy and avoid performance overhead this
patch changes deepcopy of RequestContext to shallow copy and makes
deepcopy of only the 'roles' member because of security issue
LP #1386932.

Closes-Bug: #1506958
Related-Bug: #1386932
Change-Id: I1e2c00e95e1c4bcd0ec7bf075458789d6fb06e99

commit_message:
Fix argument when calling inventory script

The dynamic inventory script was updated to use the `--config` argument
in place of the `--file` argument. This change corrects that usage
within the dynamic inventory testing.

Change-Id: I4f8408a915af69f0b04d1540cbdb5725ac91a0cb

commit_message:
Use tempest.lib clients for bulk ops

We have duplicated bulk ops code on tempest.lib and network_client
module. So this patch removes these methods from the module and
makes tests use tempest.lib ones for the code cleanup.

Change-Id: I685be88bbd47837d99b49938cfaa66ff2e199cb3

commit_message:
Support export location metadata in NetApp cDOT drivers

Since the export location metadata feature has merged in Manila core,
we can support it in the NetApp drivers. The initial need is to
report which paths are preferred.

Implements: blueprint netapp-cdot-export-location-metadata
Depends-On: Ibb88c64ddd899c09cd148f398e21ac613be9f15b
Change-Id: I77e3a6464c6da59cfafa34bd23c23740efbcf7c1

These are server-generated, not user-generated, and schema validation
should not be necessary.

Rework a unit test that enforces this; bad data should be blocked
at ingest, not blocked on reads.

Co-authored-by: Stuart McLaren <stuart.mclaren@hp.com>

Closes-Bug: 1501046

commit_message:
Skip schema validation on GET /v2/images/%s

These are server-generated, not user-generated, and schema validation
should not be necessary.

Rework a unit test that enforces this; bad data should be blocked
at ingest, not blocked on reads.

Co-authored-by: Stuart McLaren <stuart.mclaren@hp.com>
Change-Id: Ib1926fec0e858b6eed43c7931a6d6c3a1708e70e
Closes-Bug: 1501046

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 3009, 'name': 'Vladimir Kozhukalov', 'email': 'kozhukalov@gmail.com', 'username': 'kozhukalov'}, {'_account_id': 7195, 'name': 'Matthew Mosesohn', 'email': 'raytrac3r@gmail.com', 'username': 'mmosesohn'}, {'_account_id': 8003, 'name': 'Aleksandr Gordeev', 'email': 'agordeev@mirantis.com', 'username': 'agordeev'}, {'_account_id': 8789, 'name': 'Dmitry Pyzhov', 'email': 'dpyzhov+gerrit@mirantis.com', 'username': 'dpyzhov'}, {'_account_id': 8971, 'name': 'Fuel CI', 'username': 'fuel-ci', 'inactive': True, 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 11827, 'name': 'Stanislaw Bogatkin', 'email': 'regs+ubuntu.com@sbog.ru', 'username': 'sbogatkin'}, {'_account_id': 14200, 'name': 'Maksim Malchuk', 'email': 'maksim.malchuk@gmail.com', 'username': 'mmalchuk'}, {'_account_id': 18290, 'name': 'Kyrylo Galanov', 'email': 'kgalanov@mirantis.com', 'username': 'kgalanov'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-03-03 10:54:05.000000000', 'files': ['fuel_agent/tests/test_manager.py', 'fuel_agent/manager.py'], 'message': 'Disable caching for blkid calls

blkid saves block device metadata cache to a file (default location is
/dev/.blkid.tab). Because of the probabilistic nature of UUID collision
bug (which causes blkid to misinterpret partition metadata structures)
we need to make sure that all data read by blkid comes from the actual
device, not from the cache.

Passing "-c /dev/null" effectively suppresses the blkid caching.

Change-Id: I9e740286ffefb780d06437ed8e56b5f73ad6fa97
Partial-Bug: 1550227
'}]
commit_message:
Disable caching for blkid calls

blkid saves block device metadata cache to a file (default location is
/dev/.blkid.tab). Because of the probabilistic nature of UUID collision
bug (which causes blkid to misinterpret partition metadata structures)
we need to make sure that all data read by blkid comes from the actual
device, not from the cache.

Passing "-c /dev/null" effectively suppresses the blkid caching.

Change-Id: I9e740286ffefb780d06437ed8e56b5f73ad6fa97
Partial-Bug: 1550227

subject: Improve performance of resource report creating
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-09-17 18:13:02.000000000', 'files': ['openstack_dashboard/api/ceilometer.py', 'openstack_dashboard/dashboards/admin/metering/views.py', 'openstack_dashboard/utils/metering.py'], 'message': 'Improve performance of resource report creating

Currently for making ResourceUsage charts and reports
Horizon makes some nonoptimal requests to ceilometer-api

1. Hundreds (projects or resource count) statistics requests.
Statistics request is long operation that may take a long time
with large time range. Now these requests are called via
ThreadPool. These requests may make all ceilometer-api workers busy
and crash over requests.
In this CR we make one batch request and collect data from its response.

2. Hardcoded period = 1 day.
For charts with minimum periods which equal 1 day or 1 hour
it is too big period.
In this CR we used already created function calc_period which
use period = total_seconds/400

Change-Id: I6e4b43a00b271b9575d86c73fe91864cf6c1f72c
Partially-closes: bug #1444456
'}]
commit_message:
Improve performance of resource report creating

Currently for making ResourceUsage charts and reports
Horizon makes some nonoptimal requests to ceilometer-api

1. Hundreds (projects or resource count) statistics requests.
Statistics request is long operation that may take a long time
with large time range. Now these requests are called via
ThreadPool. These requests may make all ceilometer-api workers busy
and crash over requests.
In this CR we make one batch request and collect data from its response.

2. Hardcoded period = 1 day.
For charts with minimum periods which equal 1 day or 1 hour
it is too big period.
In this CR we used already created function calc_period which
use period = total_seconds/400

Change-Id: I6e4b43a00b271b9575d86c73fe91864cf6c1f72c
Partially-closes: bug #1444456

collector and notification services and storage utils.

commit_message:
Add resource_metadata for generated samples

These changes need for testing gnocchi dispatcher because in
gnocchi some metadata fields are required. In this CR
send_test_data script generate metadata for every resource.
Also this script send resource_list to pipeline if we need to
get resource list in parent process.

Change-Id: If6c8d11d23d364cdd318992a6e81e867114aad75

commit_message:
Add a storing of resource id for events

This field are required for follow proccesing events which relative
to same resource (event transformers and event statistics). It is
configured in event_definition and may define via fields jsonpath,
which are taken from notification_body or via traits which use exists traits.

Change-Id: Ib02aeaa7ea5bd1e9ff5d8033afee5b85c0037886

commit_message:
Add a 1 hour period to "metering" dashboard

Currently we use "7 day" period by default in stats tab.
On huge amount of data it's may freeze the horizon and ceilometer api.
In this CR the "1 hour" period have been added and set by default.
It helps to avoid api freeze in dashboard opening and improve user
experience for this dashboard.

Related-bug: #1444456

Change-Id: I74163120248efce80e4d2ea69a18d76dcc7f579d

subject: Fix InfluxDB tests
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2015-10-05 14:30:51.000000000', 'files': ['gnocchi/tests/base.py', 'setup-influxdb-tests.sh', 'gnocchi/storage/influxdb.py'], 'message': 'Fix InfluxDB tests

Now, InfluxDB tests are failing via Timeout error on writing
or getting data. It is caused by internal multithreading locks which
relative to measurements dropping. Also, these locks happen then
we drop measurements due the active writing measures to the current db.

So, in this patchset we avoid to drop measurements and expect that it
will deleting via retention.
For every test we use new database and it allows to use
isolated data for every test.

Also, in this CR timestamp query format have been changed for
compatibility with current Gnocchi tests.

Change-Id: I324a8a1f1b767ecc1a00c3b73a4612a4467842ef
Relative-to: bug #1488027
'}]
commit_message:
Fix InfluxDB tests

Now, InfluxDB tests are failing via Timeout error on writing
or getting data. It is caused by internal multithreading locks which
relative to measurements dropping. Also, these locks happen then
we drop measurements due the active writing measures to the current db.

So, in this patchset we avoid to drop measurements and expect that it
will deleting via retention.
For every test we use new database and it allows to use
isolated data for every test.

Also, in this CR timestamp query format have been changed for
compatibility with current Gnocchi tests.

Change-Id: I324a8a1f1b767ecc1a00c3b73a4612a4467842ef
Relative-to: bug #1488027

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-11-30 10:12:53.000000000', 'files': ['ceilometer/storage/mongo/utils.py'], 'message': "Add a read preference for the MongoDB client

Currently, if we use MongoDB Ceilometer backend
we can deploy MongoDB with ReplicaSet configuration
that provides a HA reliable data storaging.
In same time we use default MongoClient connection
that reads only from the Primary node by default.
So if Primary node falls Ceilometer can't read any data
from MongoDB during the voting (>1m in the worst case).

In this CR read preference is changed to the Primary preferred
what allows to use secondary nodes for the reading.

Change-Id: I6181ba4cda6779774f0a899d5019de266e3e0212
"}]
commit_message:
Add a read preference for the MongoDB client

Currently, if we use MongoDB Ceilometer backend
we can deploy MongoDB with ReplicaSet configuration
that provides a HA reliable data storaging.
In same time we use default MongoClient connection
that reads only from the Primary node by default.
So if Primary node falls Ceilometer can't read any data
from MongoDB during the voting (>1m in the worst case).

In this CR read preference is changed to the Primary preferred
what allows to use secondary nodes for the reading.

Change-Id: I6181ba4cda6779774f0a899d5019de266e3e0212

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 455, 'name': 'Stuart McLaren', 'email': 'stuart.mclaren@hpe.com', 'username': 'stuart-mclaren'}, {'_account_id': 5202, 'name': 'Erno Kuvaja', 'email': 'jokke@usr.fi', 'username': 'jokke'}, {'_account_id': 6159, 'name': 'Flavio Percoco Premoli', 'display_name': 'flaper87', 'email': 'flavio.percoco@flyrlabs.com', 'username': 'flaper87'}, {'_account_id': 11391, 'name': 'Mikhail Fedosin', 'email': 'mfedosin@redhat.com', 'username': 'fedosinme'}, {'_account_id': 17123, 'name': 'Tom Cocozzello (tjcocozz)', 'email': 'tjcocozz@us.ibm.com', 'username': 'tcocozzello'}]

[{'number': 3, 'created': '2016-03-04 12:42:07.000000000', 'files': ['glance/api/v2/image_data.py', 'glance/tests/functional/v2/test_images.py', 'glance/tests/unit/v2/test_image_data_resource.py'], 'message': 'Return 204 when download file from non-active image

Previously (In Liberty) when user tried to download file
from non-active image Glance returned 204. In Mitaka this
behavior was changed and now Glance returns 403.
It was done in the commit
d4d94b290ceb9147dd285822e201dd85ce812ef0

This is contrary to the Glance image api v2
http://developer.openstack.org/api-ref-image-v2.html
and we have to return the right value back.

If regular user tries to download deactivated image Glance
returns 403 as before.

Closes-bug: #1549869
ApiImpact

Change-Id: I2af3e330673eb862145e8fa09573aaa918e504a3
'}]
commit_message:
Return 204 when download file from non-active image

Previously (In Liberty) when user tried to download file
from non-active image Glance returned 204. In Mitaka this
behavior was changed and now Glance returns 403.
It was done in the commit
d4d94b290ceb9147dd285822e201dd85ce812ef0

This is contrary to the Glance image api v2
http://developer.openstack.org/api-ref-image-v2.html
and we have to return the right value back.

If regular user tries to download deactivated image Glance
returns 403 as before.

Closes-bug: #1549869
ApiImpact

Change-Id: I2af3e330673eb862145e8fa09573aaa918e504a3

commit_message:
Update parameters about authtoken middleware in proxy-server.conf.sample

This patch replaces some configration parameters about authtoken
middleware in proxy-server.conf, which will be deprecated.

The following parameters are to be deprecated.
 auth_admin_prefix, auth_host, auth_port, auth_protocol,
 identity_uri, admin_token, admin_user, admin_password,
 admin_tenant_name

Change-Id: I373734933189c87c4094203b0752dd3762689034

commit_message:
Check context before returning cached value

The key manager caches the value of barbican client to be reused,
saving an extra call to keystone.  The cached value is only
applicable to the current context, so the context must be checked
before returning the cached value.

Closes-Bug: #1523646

Change-Id: I7cd7f1ba8a749b230c611e4fb20ccf4127354c35

commit_message:
Fix sed -i flag usage

We don't need to create any backup with e SUFFIX so let's just
remove -e flag since:
        the first non-option argument is taken as the sed
        script to interpret

Change-Id: I69d658254ebe75b07c818e8aa6fb405ff33db549
Closes-bug: #1553154

revisions:
[{'number': 7, 'created': '2015-10-14 01:22:05.000000000', 'files': ['nova/volume/encryptors/cryptsetup.py', 'nova/tests/unit/volume/encryptors/test_cryptsetup.py'], 'message': 'Ignore errorcode=4 when executing `cryptsetup remove` command

If an attached encrypted volume is failed to detach from the instance
when deleting that instance, user can not delete that instance at all.

This patch adds 4 in check_exit_code when executing `cryptsetup remove`
command to eat that exception.

PS: exit_code = 4 indicate ENODEV error which means no device(also includes
the crypt device inactive).

Closes-Bug: #1482066
Change-Id: I12e2a52068850528a4bd68486344b74eb9b82c88
'}]
commit_message:
Ignore errorcode=4 when executing `cryptsetup remove` command

If an attached encrypted volume is failed to detach from the instance
when deleting that instance, user can not delete that instance at all.

This patch adds 4 in check_exit_code when executing `cryptsetup remove`
command to eat that exception.

PS: exit_code = 4 indicate ENODEV error which means no device(also includes
the crypt device inactive).

Closes-Bug: #1482066
Change-Id: I12e2a52068850528a4bd68486344b74eb9b82c88

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-02-25 15:33:17.000000000', 'files': ['undercloud_heat_plugins/server_update_allowed.py', 'undercloud_heat_plugins/__init__.py', 'setup.cfg'], 'message': 'Override OS::Nova::Server for user_data updates

This change installs a plugin to /usr/lib/heat.
This plugin replaces the OS::Nova::Server type which is a subclass that
will not replace heat servers on stack-update when the user_data
property is changed.

heat-engine needs to be restarted to register the new plugin, so there
needs to be some mechanism to ensure this during an undercloud upgrade.
It might be possible to rely on puppet doing a service restart when
"openstack undercloud install" is run again during the upgrade. Testing
will reveal whether an explicity restart openstack-heat-engine is
needed.

Any undercloud heat can be tested for whether servers are replaced on
user_data changes by running:

  heat resource-type-show OS::Nova::Server | \
    jq '.properties.user_data.update_allowed'

The result will be 'true' when this change has been successfully
applied.

The intention is that this is backported to stable/liberty to allow
overclouds to be upgraded from kilo to liberty. This issue can be fixed
in heat for Mitaka but that heat change can't be backported to Liberty.

This will work as expected for existing overcloud stacks and their
OS::Nova::Server resouces - no resource will be replaced when
ServerUpdateAllowed becomes active.

Downstream packaging needs to do the same file copying as the setup.cfg
data_files entry, which is to copy the undercloud_heat_plugins directory
to /usr/lib/heat

Change-Id: Ibd2b70527977058d18c12ea71de7f302379c50aa
Closes-Bug: #1539541
(cherry picked from commit 2fe97a4bf51853d1773c9f4eccfb0ca536f1ef35)
'}]
commit_message:
Override OS::Nova::Server for user_data updates

This change installs a plugin to /usr/lib/heat.
This plugin replaces the OS::Nova::Server type which is a subclass that
will not replace heat servers on stack-update when the user_data
property is changed.

heat-engine needs to be restarted to register the new plugin, so there
needs to be some mechanism to ensure this during an undercloud upgrade.
It might be possible to rely on puppet doing a service restart when
"openstack undercloud install" is run again during the upgrade. Testing
will reveal whether an explicity restart openstack-heat-engine is
needed.

Any undercloud heat can be tested for whether servers are replaced on
user_data changes by running:

  heat resource-type-show OS::Nova::Server | \
    jq '.properties.user_data.update_allowed'

The result will be 'true' when this change has been successfully
applied.

The intention is that this is backported to stable/liberty to allow
overclouds to be upgraded from kilo to liberty. This issue can be fixed
in heat for Mitaka but that heat change can't be backported to Liberty.

This will work as expected for existing overcloud stacks and their
OS::Nova::Server resouces - no resource will be replaced when
ServerUpdateAllowed becomes active.

Downstream packaging needs to do the same file copying as the setup.cfg
data_files entry, which is to copy the undercloud_heat_plugins directory
to /usr/lib/heat

Change-Id: Ibd2b70527977058d18c12ea71de7f302379c50aa
Closes-Bug: #1539541
(cherry picked from commit 2fe97a4bf51853d1773c9f4eccfb0ca536f1ef35)

subject: Add couchdb to global requirements
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2016-03-01 16:26:21.000000000', 'files': ['global-requirements.txt', 'upper-constraints.txt'], 'message': 'Add couchdb to global requirements

Update global requirements to get couchdb library. This
is required for running the integration tests in:
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/270443/

The python library for couchdb is maintained at:
https://pypi.python.org/pypi/CouchDB/1.0
This library is python 3 compatible. It carries the BSD license as well
as OSI approved. The code can be found at:
https://github.com/djc/couchdb-python/ and the testing results can be
viewed at: https://travis-ci.org/djc/couchdb-python. This is a new
requirement and the global-requirements.txt does not contain any
other libraries that covers any part of this functionality.

Change-Id: Iecb4552c50dfec3a5b31f60b0f1739eb4eb6e67a
'}]
commit_message:
Add couchdb to global requirements

Update global requirements to get couchdb library. This
is required for running the integration tests in:
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/270443/

The python library for couchdb is maintained at:
https://pypi.python.org/pypi/CouchDB/1.0
This library is python 3 compatible. It carries the BSD license as well
as OSI approved. The code can be found at:
https://github.com/djc/couchdb-python/ and the testing results can be
viewed at: https://travis-ci.org/djc/couchdb-python. This is a new
requirement and the global-requirements.txt does not contain any
other libraries that covers any part of this functionality.

Change-Id: Iecb4552c50dfec3a5b31f60b0f1739eb4eb6e67a

commit_message:
Update time is not updated when metadata of aggregate is updated

For example, When aggregate zone is updated, time is not getting updated
in updated_at field.

So, modified the code such that time gets updated in updated_at field
whenever the aggregate metadata content gets modified.

Change-Id: Icb65313ba85562fadeddbc1890ca5d463e74d3c2
Closes-Bug: #1538014

commit_message:
cloudkittyclient with keystone v3 not working

cloudkittyclient is failing to pass some domain/project related
information to keystoneclient, which caused "The service catalog
is empty" and "Expecting to find domain in project" error when
executing cloudkittyclient shell.

Change-Id: I386f4ecb38b947a1d8a0c8f1eee72e25ee12771a
Closes-Bug: #1547778

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 3009, 'name': 'Vladimir Kozhukalov', 'email': 'kozhukalov@gmail.com', 'username': 'kozhukalov'}, {'_account_id': 8749, 'name': 'Evgeniy L', 'email': 'eli@mirantis.com', 'username': 'evgeniyl'}, {'_account_id': 8776, 'name': 'Vladimir Sharshov', 'email': 'vsharshov@mirantis.com', 'username': 'warpc'}, {'_account_id': 8907, 'name': 'Dmitry Shulyak', 'email': 'dshulyak@mirantis.com', 'username': 'dshulyak'}, {'_account_id': 8954, 'name': 'Lukasz Oles', 'email': 'loles@mirantis.com', 'username': 'loles'}, {'_account_id': 8971, 'name': 'Fuel CI', 'username': 'fuel-ci', 'inactive': True, 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-02-10 21:06:12.000000000', 'files': ['lib/astute/puppet_task.rb', 'lib/astute/config.rb', 'spec/unit/puppet_task_spec.rb'], 'message': 'Support rerunning successful puppet tasks

This patch adds the ability to configure astute to retry successful
puppet runs immediately after a successful run. This will be used to
determine the idempotency of a given task. By default it is disabled,
but can be enabled by configuring puppet_succeed_retries in the astute
configuration file.

It will work for both methods: granular and task based deployments

Change-Id: If5af328b71067501cc2cb8d117e78287c1dcf1ad
Related-Blueprint: granular-task-idempotency
'}]
commit_message:
Support rerunning successful puppet tasks

This patch adds the ability to configure astute to retry successful
puppet runs immediately after a successful run. This will be used to
determine the idempotency of a given task. By default it is disabled,
but can be enabled by configuring puppet_succeed_retries in the astute
configuration file.

It will work for both methods: granular and task based deployments

Change-Id: If5af328b71067501cc2cb8d117e78287c1dcf1ad
Related-Blueprint: granular-task-idempotency

commit_message:
Set default NUMA topology distances

In case of one NUMA node `lstopo` doesn't return
information about distances, so by default distances
should be 2d array [["1.0"]]

Change-Id: I858c93e7f41b1a670bc72a80cd0c5b47fe63ef12
Partial-Bug: #1551955

revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2015-11-27 06:43:58.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/volume/manager.py'], 'message': "Migrate the snapshot or the clone instead of the volume

If the volume is not locked by setting to the status of
'maintenance', other API actions may terminate the migration.
In this case, we need to migrate the snapshot or the clone
of the source volume for easier migration termination.

This patch is the basic work to implement the migration
termination caused by other API actions. If the snapshot
of the source can be provided a valid local path, we take
the snapshot for further copy. Otherwise we take the clone
for further copy.

Partial-implements: blueprint migration-improvement
Change-Id: I12a8193302cac68fbc0f37c5772cdf84667d50f8
"}]
commit_message:
Migrate the snapshot or the clone instead of the volume

If the volume is not locked by setting to the status of
'maintenance', other API actions may terminate the migration.
In this case, we need to migrate the snapshot or the clone
of the source volume for easier migration termination.

This patch is the basic work to implement the migration
termination caused by other API actions. If the snapshot
of the source can be provided a valid local path, we take
the snapshot for further copy. Otherwise we take the clone
for further copy.

Partial-implements: blueprint migration-improvement
Change-Id: I12a8193302cac68fbc0f37c5772cdf84667d50f8

commit_message:
Update new user secrets in Liberty

The user-secrets-adjustments.yml playbook introduced for Kilo upgrades
is brought foward to Liberty in this commit. Since the task is logically
the same and new secrets variables were introduced, no changes from the
Kilo version are made. The documentation is updated to be more clear
about how existing secrets are handled.

Change-Id: I029b41d379d3cf3e073c7e004a9eb7986c56d1f1

subject: Fixed _winreg OpenKey parameter On 64-bit Windows systems the iSCSI initiatorname wasn't picked up from the registry, because the path parameter given to winreg.OpenKey is different than on 32-bit systems. Using 32-bit Python opened the registry in 32-bit view where the required key was missing. This patch fixes the issue by forcing Python to open the registry in 64-bit view

On 64-bit Windows systems the iSCSI initiatorname wasn't picked up from the registry, because the path parameter given to winreg.OpenKey is different than on 32-bit systems. Using 32-bit Python opened the registry in 32-bit view where the required key was missing. This patch fixes the issue by forcing Python to open the registry in 64-bit view

Change-Id: I373ff56de26fa9f110764d87dd838e8146c056da
Signed-off-by: Domonkos Tomcsanyi <tomcsanyid@modit.hu>
"}]
commit_message:
Fixed _winreg OpenKey parameter
On 64-bit Windows systems the iSCSI initiatorname wasn't picked up from the registry, because the path parameter given to winreg.OpenKey is different than on 32-bit systems. Using 32-bit Python opened the registry in 32-bit view where the required key was missing. This patch fixes the issue by forcing Python to open the registry in 64-bit view

Change-Id: I373ff56de26fa9f110764d87dd838e8146c056da
Signed-off-by: Domonkos Tomcsanyi <tomcsanyid@modit.hu>

revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2016-02-29 22:01:19.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/volume/manager.py', 'cinder/volume/api.py'], 'message': 'Add ability to failback for replication V2.1

Initially we had setup replication V2.1 (Cheesecake) to NOT
do fail-back at least in the initial version.

It turns out that fail-back in the Cinder code is rather easy,
we just enable calling failover-host on a host that's already
failed-over and use the *special* keyword of "default" as the
backend_id argument which signifies we want to switch back to
whatever is configured as the default in the cinder.conf file.

To do this we just add some logic that checks the secondary_backend_id
param in volume.manager:failover_host and set service fields
appropriately.  Note that we're sending the call to the driver
first and giving it a chance to raise an exception if it can't
satisfy the request at the current time.

We also needed to modify the volume.api:failover_host to allow
failed-over as a valid transition state, and again update the
Service query to include disabled services.

It's up to drivers to figure out if they want to require some
extra admin steps and document exactly how this works.  It's also
possible that during an initial failover that you might want to
return a status update for all volumes NOT replicated and mark
their volume-status to "error".

Expected behavior is depicted in the service output here:
    http://paste.openstack.org/show/488294/

Change-Id: I4531ab65424a7a9600b2f93ee5b5e1a0dd47d63d
'}]
commit_message:
Add ability to failback for replication V2.1

Initially we had setup replication V2.1 (Cheesecake) to NOT
do fail-back at least in the initial version.

It turns out that fail-back in the Cinder code is rather easy,
we just enable calling failover-host on a host that's already
failed-over and use the *special* keyword of "default" as the
backend_id argument which signifies we want to switch back to
whatever is configured as the default in the cinder.conf file.

To do this we just add some logic that checks the secondary_backend_id
param in volume.manager:failover_host and set service fields
appropriately.  Note that we're sending the call to the driver
first and giving it a chance to raise an exception if it can't
satisfy the request at the current time.

We also needed to modify the volume.api:failover_host to allow
failed-over as a valid transition state, and again update the
Service query to include disabled services.

It's up to drivers to figure out if they want to require some
extra admin steps and document exactly how this works.  It's also
possible that during an initial failover that you might want to
return a status update for all volumes NOT replicated and mark
their volume-status to "error".

Expected behavior is depicted in the service output here:
    http://paste.openstack.org/show/488294/

Change-Id: I4531ab65424a7a9600b2f93ee5b5e1a0dd47d63d

commit_message:
Make database/telemetry clients use rest_client

Now service_client is unnecessary because that is the same as
rest_client. This patch makes database and telemetry clients
use the rest_client, and we will remove service_client for the
cleanup in the future.

This patch removes these clients from a certain test because
this test is just for service_client, not rest_client as the
test name. We have added this test for verifying all arguments
are passed into rest_client via service_client. However, this
patch some clients use rest_client directly, so this test becomes
meaningless for these clients. That is a reason why the migrated
clients(into tempest.lib before) are not contained in this test.

NOTE: This patch changes __init__() of versions_client to use
      **kwargs because service_client removed them if each value
      is None, but rest_client doesn't do it. The purpose of the
      __init__() is just for calling self.skip_path(), so this
      change is more readable also.

Partially implements blueprint consistent-service-method-names

Change-Id: Ie99bbbe7655138c4c3ecae69ae0b361198a9651d

commit_message:
Doc on how to set up a thirdparty project

This documentation is a pre-requisite to all plugin documentation
as it guides you through the creation of a project from scratch
instead of simply forcusing on the implementation of the plugin
itself.

commit_message:
Update node names in destroy_vms

As of the testenv rebuilds the libvirt domain names have changed
format. Our destroy_vms function needs to be updated so we can
continue to destroy domains after each job and overcommit on RAM
in the way we do.

Change-Id: I57df728257b779c3a8ac539e9492a11a0dd8d4f9

commit_message:
Make image clients use rest_client

Now service_client is unnecessary because that is the same as
rest_client. This patch makes image clients use the rest_client,
and we will remove service_client for the cleanup in the future.

This patch removes these clients from a certain test because this
test is just for service_client, not rest_client as the test name.
We have added this test for verifying all arguments are passed into
rest_client via service_client. However, this patch some clients use
rest_client directly, so this test becomes meaningless for these
clients. That is a reason why the migrated clients(into tempest.lib
before) are not contained in this test.

NOTE: This patch changes __init__() of images_client to use
      **kwargs because service_client removed them if each value
      is None, but rest_client doesn't do it. The purpose of the
      __init__() is just for calling self.skip_path(), so this
      change is more readable also.

Partially implements blueprint consistent-service-method-names

Change-Id: I6655b31239d4f3d0c4601b875a4a26778fc9dd2d

Use ubuntu-trusty for most manual jobs.

* Remove experimental-docu-bindep-jobs.
* Create new gate-{name}-tox-nodb-{envlist} that uses bindep but does
  not setup databases.
* Move {name}-tox-doc-{envlist} from api-jobs to manuals-jobs and

* Rename gate-{name}-tox-doc-publish-{envlist}-bindep to
  gate-{name}-tox-doc-publish-{envlist}.

commit_message:
Use bindep for manual jobs

Use ubuntu-trusty for most manual jobs.

* Remove experimental-docu-bindep-jobs.
* Create new gate-{name}-tox-nodb-{envlist} that uses bindep but does
  not setup databases.
* Move {name}-tox-doc-{envlist} from api-jobs to manuals-jobs and
  change to use bindep.
* Rename gate-{name}-tox-doc-publish-{envlist}-bindep to
  gate-{name}-tox-doc-publish-{envlist}.

Update everything in Zuul for these changes.

Change-Id: Ia075c2dfadd23ee7814b84d0813d56c3f6d872d2

commit_message:
Add reworked version of gerrit client

Split gerrit client across 3 files

Rework gerrit_client.py toward simple and direct interface between
functional code and Gerrit Rest API

Pull common utility functions into utils.py

Add gerrit_info_provider.py and pull parsing changed modules from
review into it

Add DependencyProvider and its initial implementation

Closes-Bug: #1551640
Change-Id: I54efc625ff74037a88efe64795bd151be3f4ba89

commit_message:
Add functional regression test for list deleted instances on v2.16

There is a bug such that listing deleted instances with microversion
2.16 and greater is broken. It results in a 404. This adds a functional
regression test to exhibit the failure. The fix will build on the test
to show it's working again.

Change-Id: Ifca42c23e2ead2b533776365de29f874819cb2a8
Related-Bug: #1548980

commit_message:
Specify temporary upload dir for Horizon

By default horizon firstly uploads image to /tmp directory
and pushes it to glance then. Sometimes a lack of free space
in /tmp dir may cause cluster going offline.

Conflicts:
	deployment/puppet/openstack/manifests/horizon.pp
	deployment/puppet/openstack/spec/classes/openstack_horizon_spec.rb
	deployment/puppet/openstack/templates/horizon/wsgi_vhost_custom.erb
	deployment/puppet/osnailyfacter/modular/horizon/horizon.pp

Change-Id: Iae9f2dddb6fe6d1b350b4467599813e69e01a15d
Closes-Bug: #1496838
Depends-On: I7cb9edd3f6a31b86696d708c525cf8d031642c58

commit_message:
Make volume clients use rest_client

Now service_client is unnecessary because that is the same as
rest_client. This patch makes volume clients use the rest_client,
and we will remove service_client for the cleanup in the future.

This patch removes these clients from a certain test because this
test is just for service_client, not rest_client as the test name.
We have added this test for verifying all arguments are passed into
rest_client via service_client. However, this patch some clients use
rest_client directly, so this test becomes meaningless for these
clients. That is a reason why the migrated clients(into tempest.lib
before) are not contained in this test.

Partially implements blueprint consistent-service-method-names

Change-Id: I1f7d8bfdb23500342984508333321422f8e2366b

revisions:
[{'number': 13, 'created': '2016-02-16 21:40:40.000000000', 'files': ['nova/objects/compute_node.py', 'nova/tests/unit/objects/test_compute_node.py'], 'message': "Allow saving empty pci_device_pools in ComputeNode object

Prior to this patch, saving a ComputeNode with a pci_device_pools attribute
that has no objects specified in it (empty PciDevicePool list) would result in
the change not being saved.  Object of type PciDevicePoolList are evaluated
like a list, thefore a conditional statement like 'if pools' will always
evaluate to False even if 'pools' is not None.

Without this fix, if 'pci_passthrough_whitelist' is cleared in the
configuration, nova scheduler still think a compute node has PCI devices
available and can still trigger scheduling an instance with PCI devices on the
node.

Change-Id: Ib3c19d569b9b3b23a293ad55dd9023291435d5a6
Closes-Bug: #1487451
"}]
commit_message:
Allow saving empty pci_device_pools in ComputeNode object

Prior to this patch, saving a ComputeNode with a pci_device_pools attribute
that has no objects specified in it (empty PciDevicePool list) would result in
the change not being saved.  Object of type PciDevicePoolList are evaluated
like a list, thefore a conditional statement like 'if pools' will always
evaluate to False even if 'pools' is not None.

Without this fix, if 'pci_passthrough_whitelist' is cleared in the
configuration, nova scheduler still think a compute node has PCI devices
available and can still trigger scheduling an instance with PCI devices on the
node.

Change-Id: Ib3c19d569b9b3b23a293ad55dd9023291435d5a6
Closes-Bug: #1487451

subject: neutron: handle attach interface case with no networks
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 782, 'name': 'John Garbutt', 'email': 'john.garbutt@stackhpc.com', 'username': 'johngarbutt'}, {'_account_id': 6062, 'name': 'jichenjc', 'email': 'jichenjc@cn.ibm.com', 'username': 'jichenjc'}, {'_account_id': 6167, 'name': "Ken'ichi Ohmichi", 'email': 'ken1ohmichi@gmail.com', 'username': 'oomichi'}, {'_account_id': 7634, 'name': 'Takashi Natsume', 'email': 'takanattie@gmail.com', 'username': 'natsumet'}, {'_account_id': 9008, 'name': 'VMware NSX CI', 'username': 'vmwareminesweeper', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 9578, 'name': 'DB Datasets CI', 'email': 'turbo-hipster@lists.rcbops.com', 'username': 'turbo-hipster', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 10385, 'name': 'Citrix XenServer CI', 'username': 'citrix_xenserver_ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-02-13 02:38:30.000000000', 'files': ['nova/network/neutronv2/api.py', 'nova/tests/unit/network/test_neutronv2.py', 'nova/api/openstack/compute/attach_interfaces.py', 'nova/exception.py', 'nova/tests/unit/api/openstack/compute/test_attach_interfaces.py', 'nova/api/openstack/compute/legacy_v2/contrib/attach_interfaces.py'], 'message': "neutron: handle attach interface case with no networks

It's possible to boot an instance without a network and it's
also possible to try and attach an interface without specifying
a port, network or fixed IP. If no network is specified on the
attach request and there are no networks available to the
instance's project (shared or not), then the
allocate_port_for_instance method fails with an IndexError.

The code is currently checking for a case of ambiguous networks
when a specific network ID is not requested, but is not checking
for the case that no network ID is specified and no networks are
available. This change adds that check.

A new type of exception is raised from the network API and handled
in the REST API so we return a 400 to the user rather than a 500.

Note that we don't return an empty network_info to the compute
manager because that results in InterfaceAttachFailed raised to
the REST API which is interpreted as a 500.

Closes-Bug: #1545117

Change-Id: Iad762ebef08c259339ea5582e65266620fbab0ac
"}]
commit_message:
neutron: handle attach interface case with no networks

It's possible to boot an instance without a network and it's
also possible to try and attach an interface without specifying
a port, network or fixed IP. If no network is specified on the
attach request and there are no networks available to the
instance's project (shared or not), then the
allocate_port_for_instance method fails with an IndexError.

The code is currently checking for a case of ambiguous networks
when a specific network ID is not requested, but is not checking
for the case that no network ID is specified and no networks are
available. This change adds that check.

A new type of exception is raised from the network API and handled
in the REST API so we return a 400 to the user rather than a 500.

Note that we don't return an empty network_info to the compute
manager because that results in InterfaceAttachFailed raised to
the REST API which is interpreted as a 500.

Closes-Bug: #1545117

Change-Id: Iad762ebef08c259339ea5582e65266620fbab0ac

commit_message:
Fixes automated cleaning failure in iLO drivers

Automated cleaning fails for iLO driver if iLO is in System POST
state. iLO does not allow setting of boot device when it is in
System POST state. Node needs to be powered off before initiating
boot for cleaning.

(cherry-picked from commit 38201d9f2adff4cae77578445a528cdded9bcc87)

This change applies only to agent_ilo driver that supports in-band
cleaning in Liberty release.
Fix is made in IloVirtualMediaAgentDeploy:prepare_cleaning().

Closes-Bug: 1536730
Change-Id: Icd0f39d718aabdcad56636e662dec788c4e1b427

commit_message:
Disable clean step 'reset_ilo' for iLO drivers by default

Disable default execution of clean step 'reset_ilo' during automated
cleaning. Resetting of iLO is not required during every invocation
of automated cleaning.
(cherry picked from commit 380d6bfc52a793759f25955e4ac155893f427cb4)

Change-Id: I45a5542c8db339417916c64455eba0fae9c3f44a
Closes-Bug: 1542977

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-02-24 23:15:28.000000000', 'files': ['etc/cinder/rootwrap.d/volume.filters'], 'message': 'Add os-brick rootwrap filter for privsep

This change adds the command required to start the os-brick privsep
privileged helper process.

This should be the last "routine" merge to rootwrap filters from
os-brick, since os-brick privileged operations will now go through the
privsep mechanism.  The now-obsolete os-brick rootwrap entries will be
removed in a followup change that also bumps the os-brick minimum
version appropriately.

Change-Id: I3b2e337321875cf4abc0ab9b44fe17cf9327d88b
'}]
commit_message:
Add os-brick rootwrap filter for privsep

This change adds the command required to start the os-brick privsep
privileged helper process.

This should be the last "routine" merge to rootwrap filters from
os-brick, since os-brick privileged operations will now go through the
privsep mechanism.  The now-obsolete os-brick rootwrap entries will be
removed in a followup change that also bumps the os-brick minimum
version appropriately.

Change-Id: I3b2e337321875cf4abc0ab9b44fe17cf9327d88b

[{'number': 10, 'created': '2016-02-29 21:33:14.000000000', 'files': ['releasenotes/notes/storwize-multiple-management-ip-1cd364d63879d9b8.yaml', 'cinder/volume/drivers/ibm/storwize_svc/storwize_svc_common.py', 'cinder/tests/unit/test_storwize_svc.py'], 'message': "Storwize SVC multiple management IPs

Right now Storwize SVC does not support multiple management IPs.
This patch adds this feature so that if the primary IP fails, it
will switch to the secondary IP that the user sets.

DocImpact
Adds config option 'storwize_san_secondary_ip'

Implements: blueprint storwize-add-support-for-multiple-management-ips
Change-Id: Ib82ba5b43e92027bfe39873a556baec796bb457e
"}]
commit_message:
Storwize SVC multiple management IPs

Right now Storwize SVC does not support multiple management IPs.
This patch adds this feature so that if the primary IP fails, it
will switch to the secondary IP that the user sets.

DocImpact
Adds config option 'storwize_san_secondary_ip'

Implements: blueprint storwize-add-support-for-multiple-management-ips
Change-Id: Ib82ba5b43e92027bfe39873a556baec796bb457e

commit_message:
Set 'DEBUG = False' in cobbler/web/settings.py

Cobbler in debug mode is slow, so we set 'DEBUG = False'
in /usr/share/cobbler/web/settings.py instead of default 'True' value.

Change-Id: I2f1c190ecaa44ea4ac4b82037a61c2c5ac5d74f1
Closes-bug: #1544494

commit_message:
Provide identity_uri & auth_uri for Ceilometer (compute)

Key moments:
  * provide keystone_identity_uri and keystone_auth_uri in ceilometer
    compute modular
  * update noop test to verify this parameters in ceilometer.conf
  * stop using deprecated parameters in openstack::ceilometer for
    ceilometer::api (use identity_uri & auth_uri)
  * update test for openstack::ceilometer (rename parameters)

Closes-bug: #1551332

Change-Id: I3aafbaf9dced7ae211c5cdec2c79470e78f43b1b

subject: Fix unittests after new release of glanceclient
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-03-04 01:03:44.000000000', 'files': ['ironic/tests/common/test_glance_service.py'], 'message': 'Fix unittests after new release of glanceclient

Two unittests in the test_glance_service.py module was depending on
getting an instance of the real glanceclient and it was failing due a
new glanceclient release. This patch is fixing the problem by mocking
the client instanciation.

Closes-bug: #1552839
Closes-Bug: #1552834
Co-Authored-By: Lucas Alvares Gomes <lucasagomes@gmail.com>
Change-Id: Ic9dc3f1016667c6d7ec5ee324d5fff48af82c581
(cherry picked from commit 036b959b9245ba44b5ea895ea48584dedc282fdf)
'}]
commit_message:
Fix unittests after new release of glanceclient

Two unittests in the test_glance_service.py module was depending on
getting an instance of the real glanceclient and it was failing due a
new glanceclient release. This patch is fixing the problem by mocking
the client instanciation.

Closes-bug: #1552839
Closes-Bug: #1552834
Co-Authored-By: Lucas Alvares Gomes <lucasagomes@gmail.com>
Change-Id: Ic9dc3f1016667c6d7ec5ee324d5fff48af82c581
(cherry picked from commit 036b959b9245ba44b5ea895ea48584dedc282fdf)

commit_message:
Remove duplicate doc in ironic.conf.sample

In the configuration sample file, the possible choices for some
configuration options is described twice. Once via `# Possible values:`
and the other as part of the help description. This will remove the
duplication in the help.

Change-Id: Ifaba17ea9029aa99db3ddffa9b7750c05b47460c

commit_message:
Fix argument order for assertEqual to (expected, observed)

assertEqual expects that the arguments provided to it should be (expected, observed).
If a particluar order is kept as a convention, then it helps to provide a cleaner
message to the developer if Unit Tests fail.
The following patch fixes this issue

TrivialFix

Change-Id: Id417fb43ecd62563239d492bff3981277565525e
Closes-Bug: #1259292

subject: Fix cacert and insecure options on HTTP requests
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2016-03-03 01:20:48.000000000', 'files': ['mistralclient/tests/unit/test_client.py', 'mistralclient/tests/unit/test_httpclient.py', 'mistralclient/api/httpclient.py', 'mistralclient/api/v2/client.py'], 'message': 'Fix cacert and insecure options on HTTP requests

On running mistral API with SSL, the client SSL options such as cacert and
insecure are only passed to the authentication request and are not passed
to the mistral client and mistral API subsequently.

Change-Id: I35d013c468977fc3df578afcacc7f7a5cc3173c6
Closes-Bug: #1552030
'}]
commit_message:
Fix cacert and insecure options on HTTP requests

On running mistral API with SSL, the client SSL options such as cacert and
insecure are only passed to the authentication request and are not passed
to the mistral client and mistral API subsequently.

Change-Id: I35d013c468977fc3df578afcacc7f7a5cc3173c6
Closes-Bug: #1552030

subject: Security: Check for grub.cfg first
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-02-29 20:15:45.000000000', 'files': ['tests/test.yml', 'tasks/boot.yml'], 'message': 'Security: Check for grub.cfg first

As noted in bug 1550426, the tasks for grub.cfg will fail if
the file is not present. This patch checks for the grub.cfg
and only tries to make changes if the file is present.

Closes-bug: 1550426

Change-Id: Id5368dfa2c24d555c59f9ceef4676f3d15706ad9
'}]
commit_message:
Security: Check for grub.cfg first

As noted in bug 1550426, the tasks for grub.cfg will fail if
the file is not present. This patch checks for the grub.cfg
and only tries to make changes if the file is present.

Closes-bug: 1550426

Change-Id: Id5368dfa2c24d555c59f9ceef4676f3d15706ad9

revisions:
[{'number': 7, 'created': '2016-02-19 02:31:44.000000000', 'files': ['heatclient/common/template_format.py'], 'message': 'Fix json key/value type error because of whitespace

1). Json.loads () will not remove the whitespace of the key/value,
    once we write a key word like "description " or ' description',
    it will cause type parsing errors.
2). Heat can not parse a Json file which start will whitespace,because
    we are not remove whitespace before we use "if tmpl_str.startswith('{'):"
    to judge a json file.

Closes-Bug: #1546408
Change-Id: If77749e24e3b8e806f4c52dfd4d2d65dc4d650b4
'}]
commit_message:
Fix json key/value type error because of whitespace

1). Json.loads () will not remove the whitespace of the key/value,
    once we write a key word like "description " or ' description',
    it will cause type parsing errors.
2). Heat can not parse a Json file which start will whitespace,because
    we are not remove whitespace before we use "if tmpl_str.startswith('{'):"
    to judge a json file.

Closes-Bug: #1546408
Change-Id: If77749e24e3b8e806f4c52dfd4d2d65dc4d650b4

commit_message:
Code refactor for v2-v3

Refactoring code:
- reusing logic from v2.0 in v3.0
- fix Versions endpoint
 - was conflicting with /healthcheck
 - template dict VERSIONS was mutated every request
- reorganized endpoints package structure
- moved Healthchecks and Versions directly into
reference package. Those endpoints are neither
part of v2.0 nor v3.0
- added deprecated marker to /v2.0/log/single

Change-Id: Ic51fd283c919af9a3cb40e49a892e14756646d60

commit_message:
Fix bootstrap.sh

On recent test machines, curl isn't available anymore, so use wget
instead. Piping directly into bash isn't that great anyway.

Change-Id: I7faa2a67e9233ed68e16e25cd24afe2120df6cda

subject: do not propose a new keystone config file if already approved
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-03-03 08:29:09.000000000', 'files': ['jenkins/scripts/common.sh', 'jenkins/scripts/propose_updated_config_file.sh', 'jenkins/scripts/common_translation_update.sh'], 'message': 'do not propose a new keystone config file if already approved

Borrowing from common_translation_update.sh, the config file
proposal should behave the same way. if there is already an
approved job, then we can wait to propose a new revision once it
has been merged.

Moved the original code that perfoms the check into common.sh
and named it check_already_approved.

Change-Id: I48180f8580a54749248a25505edbc1303457e2e4
'}]
commit_message:
do not propose a new keystone config file if already approved

Borrowing from common_translation_update.sh, the config file
proposal should behave the same way. if there is already an
approved job, then we can wait to propose a new revision once it
has been merged.

Moved the original code that perfoms the check into common.sh
and named it check_already_approved.

Change-Id: I48180f8580a54749248a25505edbc1303457e2e4

revisions:
[{'number': 6, 'created': '2016-02-27 08:09:01.000000000', 'files': ['gerrit/acls/openstack/fuxi.config', 'jenkins/jobs/projects.yaml', 'gerrit/projects.yaml', 'zuul/layout.yaml'], 'message': 'Add new project(fuxi) to openstack

Fuxi focuses on enabling Docker container to use Cinder volume
and Manila share, thus Docker volume can reuse the advance

With Fuxi, Cinder and Manila can be used as the unified

Change-Id: I1d7c6dbb471a176cd73625af7c1f2211e3c49e47

commit_message:
Add new project(fuxi) to openstack

Fuxi focuses on enabling Docker container to use Cinder volume
and Manila share, thus Docker volume can reuse the advance
features and numerous vendor drivers in Cinder and Manila.
With Fuxi, Cinder and Manila can be used as the unified
persistence storage provider for virtual machine, baremetal and
Docker container.

Change-Id: I1d7c6dbb471a176cd73625af7c1f2211e3c49e47

subject: Dont include plugin definition in cmd checks
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-03-03 21:04:10.000000000', 'files': ['jenkins/scripts/check_osc_commands.py'], 'message': "Dont include plugin definition in cmd checks

The ep for the openstack.cli.extension plugin definition
was being included in the command dict:
'orchestration': ['heatclient.osc.plugin']
Since this is not a command, should be pruned.
This was causing false positives in the overlap checking.

Change-Id: I56ec1c5d55d0efc75f59c10a44e367e330c42def
"}]
commit_message:
Dont include plugin definition in cmd checks

The ep for the openstack.cli.extension plugin definition
was being included in the command dict:
'orchestration': ['heatclient.osc.plugin']
Since this is not a command, should be pruned.
This was causing false positives in the overlap checking.

Change-Id: I56ec1c5d55d0efc75f59c10a44e367e330c42def

commit_message:
Replace null in output of security-group-show with ''

Because of [1], there might be '' in security group rule.
This patch will prevent neutron client from thinking that the empty
string is a valid value.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/288277/

Change-Id: I08ebea75f2b7f3020dfb84978c49e35f8e821330
Partial-Bug: #1542819

subject: Remove tests omission from coverage target in tox.ini
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-03-04 07:36:58.000000000', 'files': ['tox.ini'], 'message': 'Remove tests omission from coverage target in tox.ini

In coverage target in tox.ini, there is the following argument:
  --omit="watcher/tests/*"

However, in .coveragerc, the tests are also omitted,
according to line 4 in .coveragerc:
  omit = watcher/tests/*

So the watcher/tests/* directory is omitted twice. As it can be
seen in other modules (e.g.: swift, nova) omitting only in
.coveragerc should be enough.

Change-Id: I72951196a346fb73a90c998138fc91dd171432cd
Closes-Bug: #1552617
'}]
commit_message:
Remove tests omission from coverage target in tox.ini

In coverage target in tox.ini, there is the following argument:
  --omit="watcher/tests/*"

However, in .coveragerc, the tests are also omitted,
according to line 4 in .coveragerc:
  omit = watcher/tests/*

So the watcher/tests/* directory is omitted twice. As it can be
seen in other modules (e.g.: swift, nova) omitting only in
.coveragerc should be enough.

Change-Id: I72951196a346fb73a90c998138fc91dd171432cd
Closes-Bug: #1552617

commit_message:
Replace null in output of security-group-show with ''

Currently, the output of "neutron security-group-show" will contain null
in the "security_group_rules" field. It is not user friendly and not
consistent with "neutron security-group-rule-show" and
"neutron security-group-rule-list". This is demonstrated in [1]

This patch replace the null with an empty string ''. This is demonstrated
in [2].

[1] http://paste.openstack.org/show/486190/
[2] http://paste.openstack.org/show/489272/

Change-Id: I4c7a08a27d940c5266d7b24449ba1b439d78aac1
Partial-Bug: #1542819

revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2016-03-01 18:00:26.000000000', 'files': ['neutron_lbaas/db/migration/alembic_migrations/versions/CONTRACT_HEAD', 'neutron_lbaas/db/migration/alembic_migrations/versions/EXPAND_HEAD'], 'message': 'Track alembic heads

Not strictly necessary, but helps to sequence merges that add
migrations.

This prevents two patches with the same downrev from merging.
Previously, if two patches with the same downrev merged, then a
follow-up patch would be needed to fix one of the migration
scripts, which is never a good thing.

Change-Id: If317fd6f0bea5d442289c39bc59ca770016f8800
'}]
commit_message:
Track alembic heads

Not strictly necessary, but helps to sequence merges that add
migrations.

This prevents two patches with the same downrev from merging.
Previously, if two patches with the same downrev merged, then a
follow-up patch would be needed to fix one of the migration
scripts, which is never a good thing.

Change-Id: If317fd6f0bea5d442289c39bc59ca770016f8800

commit_message:
Correlate address scope with network

With address scope being enabled, networks now are in one ipv4
address scope and one ipv6 address scope.

This patch adds derived attributes to the network as part of the
address scopes extension that will show related address scopes
when viewing a network through the API.

APIImpact

Change-Id: Ib1657636033ad2c0009d50ebe7c5ae4f72f6b175
Closes-Bug: #1547380

subject: Fix manila-image-elements publish job
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-03-03 22:03:58.000000000', 'files': ['jenkins/jobs/manila.yaml'], 'message': "Fix manila-image-elements publish job

Although a publish job exists for manila-image-elements,
it doesn't upload anything because the filename it was
looking for was not created by the build. This patch
fixes the filename, and also renames tagged versions to
something different so they don't get overwritten.

Change-Id: Icea85a000cb68ae7befecadcca0ba7138fe7c7c2
"}]
commit_message:
Fix manila-image-elements publish job

Although a publish job exists for manila-image-elements,
it doesn't upload anything because the filename it was
looking for was not created by the build. This patch
fixes the filename, and also renames tagged versions to
something different so they don't get overwritten.

Change-Id: Icea85a000cb68ae7befecadcca0ba7138fe7c7c2

subject: Revision to FEATURES.rst
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-03-03 08:13:56.000000000', 'files': ['FEATURES.rst'], 'message': "Revision to FEATURES.rst

This patch proposes several changes to the FEATURES list:

- 'Support Scheduled Actions' [High->Middle]
  This is supposed to be a feature from monitoring services, e.g.
  Ceilometer/Aodh where they have cron based event/alarms.

- 'API Versioning Support' [Middle->High]
  With a first official release coming soon, we need to freeze API
  changes to 1.0. Any future changes will need a bump of API version
  unless it is a pure bug-fix. However, before bumping API versions,
  we need a API versioning scheme in place to manage the versions.

- 'CoreOS based Container Support' [Low->High]
  Since CoreOS is just a VM image positioned as a guest OS on OpenStack.
  We can easily support it with not much effort. The lessons/experiences
  learned therein would be very helpful for guiding our next step
  towards managing container clusters.

- 'Define and Enforce Quotas' [Middle->Low]
  This is no longer merely a senlin project's concern. There is a
  cross-project effort on doing this. We will just need to keep an eye
  on that effort instead of doing local inventions.
  [https://review.openstack.org/284454]

- 'Container/Docker Support' [Low->Middle]
  We are working toward that direction anyway, though there are many
  details to be figured out.

- 'Make use of ServerGroup API' [Low->DELETED]
  We are already doing that in the 'affinity' policy.

- 'Versioned Object Support' [Low->Middle]
  We will need such a feature to support live service upgrade. This
  has to be done before Newton release (Oct/2016).

Change-Id: I9eb8e093dc7fe3779a8d05e9ab8feb1cd93f7fb3
"}]
commit_message:
Revision to FEATURES.rst

This patch proposes several changes to the FEATURES list:

- 'Support Scheduled Actions' [High->Middle]
  This is supposed to be a feature from monitoring services, e.g.
  Ceilometer/Aodh where they have cron based event/alarms.

- 'API Versioning Support' [Middle->High]
  With a first official release coming soon, we need to freeze API
  changes to 1.0. Any future changes will need a bump of API version
  unless it is a pure bug-fix. However, before bumping API versions,
  we need a API versioning scheme in place to manage the versions.

- 'CoreOS based Container Support' [Low->High]
  Since CoreOS is just a VM image positioned as a guest OS on OpenStack.
  We can easily support it with not much effort. The lessons/experiences
  learned therein would be very helpful for guiding our next step
  towards managing container clusters.

- 'Define and Enforce Quotas' [Middle->Low]
  This is no longer merely a senlin project's concern. There is a
  cross-project effort on doing this. We will just need to keep an eye
  on that effort instead of doing local inventions.
  [https://review.openstack.org/284454]

- 'Container/Docker Support' [Low->Middle]
  We are working toward that direction anyway, though there are many
  details to be figured out.

- 'Make use of ServerGroup API' [Low->DELETED]
  We are already doing that in the 'affinity' policy.

- 'Versioned Object Support' [Low->Middle]
  We will need such a feature to support live service upgrade. This
  has to be done before Newton release (Oct/2016).

Change-Id: I9eb8e093dc7fe3779a8d05e9ab8feb1cd93f7fb3

subject: Bump python-senlinclient version to 0.3.0
revisions:
[{'number': 8, 'created': '2016-03-04 00:35:52.000000000', 'files': ['global-requirements.txt', 'upper-constraints.txt'], 'message': "Bump python-senlinclient version to 0.3.0

Bump senlinclient version. Version 0.3.0 completely rewrote the client
interface and deperecated the previous one. Callers don't have to know
the resource-level abstractions any more. The only known downstream
projects are: senlin-dashboard and heat. Both projects are already
migrated to the interface exposed by 0.3.0. We have no plan to continue
support older version (<=0.2.1) which are really buggy.

On the other hand, this patch raises the upper constraint to version
0.4.0 we just released. The new version contains a full support to OSC
(openstackclient) plugins. Users are not forced to do that migration.
The calling interface remained downward compatible to that of 0.3.0.

Change-Id: Ic8c832d1c89aa5205279ab8ba8a89f673364add3
"}]
commit_message:
Bump python-senlinclient version to 0.3.0

Bump senlinclient version. Version 0.3.0 completely rewrote the client
interface and deperecated the previous one. Callers don't have to know
the resource-level abstractions any more. The only known downstream
projects are: senlin-dashboard and heat. Both projects are already
migrated to the interface exposed by 0.3.0. We have no plan to continue
support older version (<=0.2.1) which are really buggy.

On the other hand, this patch raises the upper constraint to version
0.4.0 we just released. The new version contains a full support to OSC
(openstackclient) plugins. Users are not forced to do that migration.
The calling interface remained downward compatible to that of 0.3.0.

Change-Id: Ic8c832d1c89aa5205279ab8ba8a89f673364add3

commit_message:
Sample nova.conf file has missing/duplicated config options

The generated sample.nova.conf missed config options from these modules:
   nova.virt.hyperv.eventhandler
   nova.virt.libvirt.volume.aoe
   nova.virt.libvirt.volume.glusterfs
   nova.virt.libvirt.volume.iscsi
   nova.virt.libvirt.volume.iser
   nova.virt.libvirt.volume.net
   nova.virt.libvirt.volume.nfs
   nova.virt.libvirt.volume.quobyte
   nova.virt.libvirt.volume.remotefs
   nova.virt.libvirt.volume.scality
   nova.virt.libvirt.volume.smbfs

The generated sample.nova.conf has the config options twice from module:
   nova.cmd.spicehtml5proxy.opts

Change-Id: I81524527c204c56547d27a9450fffafa0f81c11e
Co-Authored-By: Dirk Mueller <dirk@dmllr.de>
Co-Authored-By: zwei <leidong@unitedstack.com>
Co-Authored-By: Michal Jura <mjura@suse.com>
Closes-Bug: #1532228
Closes-Bug: #1533132

subject: Fix CI status on both ubuntu/centos
revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2016-03-04 03:18:24.000000000', 'files': ['fixtures/scenario001.pp', 'manifests/init.pp'], 'message': "Fix CI status on both ubuntu/centos

Both changes need to happen in the same patchset.

1/ centos/workaround: make sure Keystone installed before RabbitMQ

We currently have an issue in Puppet OpenStack CI where DIB image for
centos7 has a modified version of /etc/login.defs that allows RabbitMQ
to steal UID of OpenStack packaging (Keystone most often).

While we are investigating that, this patch is a workaround to make sure
we first install Keystone and then RabbitMQ, on centos7 systems.

2/ disable telemetry tests on Ubuntu.
UCA is currently updating Ceilometer / Aodh and tests are broken now.
Let's skip them.

Change-Id: Ibfc3988a4de47c9d7d97159e7d1c0e57d64979ae
"}]
commit_message:
Fix CI status on both ubuntu/centos

Both changes need to happen in the same patchset.

1/ centos/workaround: make sure Keystone installed before RabbitMQ

We currently have an issue in Puppet OpenStack CI where DIB image for
centos7 has a modified version of /etc/login.defs that allows RabbitMQ
to steal UID of OpenStack packaging (Keystone most often).

While we are investigating that, this patch is a workaround to make sure
we first install Keystone and then RabbitMQ, on centos7 systems.

2/ disable telemetry tests on Ubuntu.
UCA is currently updating Ceilometer / Aodh and tests are broken now.
Let's skip them.

Change-Id: Ibfc3988a4de47c9d7d97159e7d1c0e57d64979ae

subject: Fixed imcompatible argument in service create with keystone v2/3 API
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-03-02 09:31:43.000000000', 'files': ['tests/unit/plugins/openstack/scenarios/keystone/test_utils.py', 'rally/plugins/openstack/scenarios/keystone/utils.py'], 'message': 'Fixed imcompatible argument in service create with keystone v2/3 API

The keystone service create scenario will complain about wrong
argument type with keystone v3 API,
While the third argument is a boolean value indicating whether
the service is enabled in v3, it was a string value to describe
service description in v2.

This commit fixes the issue by simply using the keyword
for the description argument as it is accepted in both versions.

Change-Id: Iba1b5f09b8efbf6a73d34e913bc3083cf57d2451
Closes-Bug: #1469897
'}]
commit_message:
Fixed imcompatible argument in service create with keystone v2/3 API

The keystone service create scenario will complain about wrong
argument type with keystone v3 API,
While the third argument is a boolean value indicating whether
the service is enabled in v3, it was a string value to describe
service description in v2.

This commit fixes the issue by simply using the keyword
for the description argument as it is accepted in both versions.

Change-Id: Iba1b5f09b8efbf6a73d34e913bc3083cf57d2451
Closes-Bug: #1469897

commit_message:
Abstract a driver API for triggering crash dump

An implementation to trigger crash dump depends on hypervisors. Inject_nmi is
just a libvirt implementation. The driver API name should be
"trigger_crash_dump" for the abstraction.

This patch only changes names of the driver API and an Exception. It has no
functional changes.

Change-Id: Icef57d346fac7f92132bc14e22d5b2652397a64a
Closes-Bug: 1547362

commit_message:
local_settings needs 2.76% more ',' and an '_'

While updating my local_settings.py file to more closely represent the
local_settings.py.example file, I noticed a small error (that's normally
commented out).

The VHD openstack image backend image format isn't being translated due
to a missing underscore.

I also noticed a few "missing" commas on the last element in a few lists
and dicts.

Change-Id: Ifef05c23921b88d7fc7f331cf293bbbd608af704
Closes-Bug: 1552955

commit_message:
Add CHAPPASSWORD to list of sanitize keys

The Huawei cinder driver needs to mask out any instances of the
CHAPPASSWORD in the logs [1]. This patch adds to the sanitize
keys list so that cinder may make use of the common mask_password
function.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/271595

Change-Id: I679e576121e2a74ac6684ecc634690708cf39315
Partial-Bug: #1535706

commit_message:
Make some agent functions require exclusive lock

1. prepare(): do_node_deploy() use an exclusive lock
2. clear_up(): do_node_tear_down() use an exclusive lock
3. heartbeat(): vendor_passthru() use an exclusive lock

Change-Id: I0bb4155f6b052b594f78401cae93d872dd9e5c1b

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-03-01 17:08:12.000000000', 'files': ['puppet/manifests/overcloud_controller.pp', 'puppet/controller.yaml', 'puppet/manifests/overcloud_controller_pacemaker.pp', 'puppet/hieradata/controller.yaml'], 'message': 'Enable notifications on the overcloud

Configures all services to send notifications to rabbit.  The puppet
modules are not consistent regarding how this is done - some expose
notification config as a top-level param, others you need to set it
through a *_config structure, and cinder provides a separate class
dedicated to enabling ceilometer notifications.

Changes were needed for the cherry-pick because the stable/liberty
puppet modules do not expose as many notification parameters as
the master ones.

Change-Id: I23e2ddad3c59a06cfbfe5d896a16e6bad2abd943
(cherry picked from commit a1164462bf15b548e3111c1eea663a37d1ae9e7a)
'}]
commit_message:
Enable notifications on the overcloud

Configures all services to send notifications to rabbit.  The puppet
modules are not consistent regarding how this is done - some expose
notification config as a top-level param, others you need to set it
through a *_config structure, and cinder provides a separate class
dedicated to enabling ceilometer notifications.

Changes were needed for the cherry-pick because the stable/liberty
puppet modules do not expose as many notification parameters as
the master ones.

Change-Id: I23e2ddad3c59a06cfbfe5d896a16e6bad2abd943
(cherry picked from commit a1164462bf15b548e3111c1eea663a37d1ae9e7a)

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-03-03 05:29:26.000000000', 'files': ['sahara/service/coordinator.py'], 'message': 'Added #nosec to sahara.service.coordinator package

The sahara.service.coordinator module uses an MD5 hash to identify
object instances that it knows about. These object identifiers are
not exposed outside the application, and as such have a low
likelihood of generating hash collisions produced by an attacker.
The usage should be marked with nosec as per the bandit documentation.

Change-Id: I995ae9eedc35f387c2259d62c25e5d73252de683
Closes-Bug: #1552476
'}]
commit_message:
Added #nosec to sahara.service.coordinator package

The sahara.service.coordinator module uses an MD5 hash to identify
object instances that it knows about. These object identifiers are
not exposed outside the application, and as such have a low
likelihood of generating hash collisions produced by an attacker.
The usage should be marked with nosec as per the bandit documentation.

Change-Id: I995ae9eedc35f387c2259d62c25e5d73252de683
Closes-Bug: #1552476

finder functions. Otherwsie, this would not work for in-instance

commit_message:
Use stored_context in describe_stack_resource

Use stored context to load the stack, as we load the resources
from the template and resource translations need to call client
finder functions. Otherwsie, this would not work for in-instance
users.

Change-Id: I0c43b1e89feed6a5c9952cfd37bc14ae30258572
Partial-Bug: #bug/1544227

subject: Add python-searchlightclient>=0.2.0
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2016-03-03 00:44:09.000000000', 'files': ['global-requirements.txt', 'upper-constraints.txt'], 'message': 'Add python-searchlightclient>=0.2.0

This add python-searchlightclient>=0.2.0

https://github.com/openstack/requirements#for-new-requirements

Is the library actively maintained?

It is part of the Searchlight group. Maybe just look at full history:

http://stackalytics.com/?module=searchlight-group&release=all

It is new this release of OpenStack.

Is the library good code?

It has followed the gerrit review process, so we believe it is in
reasonable shape.

Is the library python 3 compatible?

We have the python3 gate check enabled.

https://github.com/openstack-infra/project-config/
blob/master/zuul/layout.yaml#L9477-L9485

Is the library license compatible?

Apache 2.0

Is the library already packaged in the distros we target
(Ubuntu latest / Fedora latest)?

Probably not. This is the first release.

Is the function of this library already covered by other libraries
in global-requirements.txt?

No.


Change-Id: I65ac651d7d02d5a751736b2fedcd02047bb8c01c
'}]
commit_message:
Add python-searchlightclient>=0.2.0

This add python-searchlightclient>=0.2.0

https://github.com/openstack/requirements#for-new-requirements

Is the library actively maintained?

It is part of the Searchlight group. Maybe just look at full history:

http://stackalytics.com/?module=searchlight-group&release=all

It is new this release of OpenStack.

Is the library good code?

It has followed the gerrit review process, so we believe it is in
reasonable shape.

Is the library python 3 compatible?

We have the python3 gate check enabled.

https://github.com/openstack-infra/project-config/
blob/master/zuul/layout.yaml#L9477-L9485

Is the library license compatible?

Apache 2.0

Is the library already packaged in the distros we target
(Ubuntu latest / Fedora latest)?

Probably not. This is the first release.

Is the function of this library already covered by other libraries
in global-requirements.txt?

No.


Change-Id: I65ac651d7d02d5a751736b2fedcd02047bb8c01c

commit_message:
Remove redundant attach volume API

Compute API reference was referring to a wrong volume-attach API
in server actions section. The volume attach is done through a
dedicated os-volume_attachments API which is already captured
in the Compute API reference

Change-Id: Ie7b85c390733983abab2f2facd50fe2b3de14113
Closes-Bug: #1530738

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-03-03 15:46:58.000000000', 'files': ['doc/admin-guide-cloud/source/networking_config-agents.rst'], 'message': "lbaas: use stevedore entrypoint for service plugin

Using full python import names is not recommended or supported. It's
also error prone since any original python module rename will break
setups relying on internal python paths.

Instead of it, use stevedore alias:

https://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack/neutron-lbaas/tree/setup.cfg#n47

Change-Id: I6f9522031b4cbe373fea0032f8e7fb1fcaf9e910
"}]
commit_message:
lbaas: use stevedore entrypoint for service plugin

Using full python import names is not recommended or supported. It's
also error prone since any original python module rename will break
setups relying on internal python paths.

Instead of it, use stevedore alias:

https://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack/neutron-lbaas/tree/setup.cfg#n47

Change-Id: I6f9522031b4cbe373fea0032f8e7fb1fcaf9e910

commit_message:

"forbidden (403)" instead of "403" and "ItemNotFound (404)" instead
of "404" value.

commit_message:
Fixed incorrect exception raising in ManilaShare

In ResourceInError there are two arguments it needs
to create an exception message. status_reason is
optional and is replaced by 'Unknown'. resource_status
was expected but ManilaShare gives only status_reason,
but no resource_status. I changed ManilaShare to
give resource_status too.

Closes-Bug: #1552716
Change-Id: Ie65b5d8c740b47a3f4ae795bf69df0692f8598d3

subject: Fixed default for networks on server creation
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-03-03 21:07:29.000000000', 'files': ['api-ref/src/wadls/compute-api/src/v2.1/common.ent'], 'message': 'Fixed default for networks on server creation

When creating a server, the user may pass a "networks" parameter.
The documentation said that the default is to attach the server to all
tenant's networks, but this is not true.
The default is to attach the server to the tenant network if there's
only one network in the tenant, but if there is more than one network,
the user must specify a network or an error will bethrown.

Change-Id: I656f1f272777e93f66d2e3717a76e64ae53b7a99
Closes-Bug: #1548815
'}]
commit_message:
Fixed default for networks on server creation

When creating a server, the user may pass a "networks" parameter.
The documentation said that the default is to attach the server to all
tenant's networks, but this is not true.
The default is to attach the server to the tenant network if there's
only one network in the tenant, but if there is more than one network,
the user must specify a network or an error will bethrown.

Change-Id: I656f1f272777e93f66d2e3717a76e64ae53b7a99
Closes-Bug: #1548815
